fields.name: Best Novel
fields.description: A science fiction or fantasy story of 40,000 words or more, published for the first time in 2021.

fields.name: Best Novella
fields.description: A science fiction or fantasy story between 17,500 and 40,000 words, which appeared for the first time in 2021.

fields.name: Best Novelette
fields.description: A science fiction or fantasy story between 7,500 and 17,500 words, which appeared for the first time in 2021.

fields.name: Best Short Story
fields.description: A science fiction or fantasy story of fewer than 7,500 words, which appeared for the first time in 2021.

fields.name: Best Series
fields.description: A multi-volume science fiction or fantasy story, unified by elements such as plot, characters, setting, and presentation, which has appeared in at least three (3) volumes consisting of a total of at least 240,000 words by the close of the calendar year 2021, at least one of which was published in 2021, and which has not previously won under 3.3.5 of the WSFS Constitution.
fields.nominating_details:
Previous losing finalists in the Best Series category shall be eligible only upon the publication of at least two (2) additional installments consisting in total of at least 240,000 words after they qualified for their last appearance on the final ballot and by the close of 2021.

If any series and a subset series thereof both receive sufficient nominations to appear on the final ballot, only the version which received more nominations shall appear.

## Note regarding 2022 Best Series eligibility

Previous winners of the Hugo for Best Series are *not* eligible in the Best Series category. They are:

  * The Vorkosigan Saga, by Lois McMaster Bujold
  * The World of the Five Gods, by Lois McMaster Bujold
  * Wayfarers, by Becky Chambers
  * The Expanse, by James S. A. Corey
  * [2021 Best Series Winner - to be filled in after DC3â€™s Hugo Awards ceremony]

The following finalists for the Hugo Award for Best Series in 2017 are *not* eligible in 2022 *unless* they have published at least two (2) additional installments consisting in total of at least 240,000 words between January 1, 2017 and December 31, 2021:

  * The Temeraire series, by Naomi Novik
  * The Craft Sequence, by Max Gladstone
  * The Peter Grant / Rivers of London series, by Ben Aaronovitch

The following finalists for the Hugo Award for Best Series in 2018 are *not* eligible in 2022 *unless* they have published at least two (2) additional installments consisting in total of at least 240,000 words between January 1, 2018 and December 31, 2021:

  * The Books of the Raksura, by Martha Wells
  * The Divine Cities, by Robert Jackson Bennett
  * The Memoirs of Lady Trent, by Marie Brennan
  * The Stormlight Archive, by Brandon Sanderson

The following finalists for the Hugo Award for Best Series in 2019 are *not* eligible in 2022 *unless* they have published at least two (2) additional installments consisting in total of at least 240,000 words between January 1, 2019 and December 31, 2021:

  * The Centenal Cycle, by Malka Older
  * The Laundry Files, by Charles Stross
  * Machineries of Empire, by Yoon Ha Lee
  * The Universe of Xuya, by Aliette de Bodard

The following finalists for the Hugo Award for Best Series in 2020 are *not* eligible in 2022 *unless* they have published at least two (2) additional installments consisting in total of at least 240,000 words between January 1, 2020 and December 31, 2021:

  * InCryptid, by Seanan McGuire
  * Luna, by Ian McDonald
  * Planetfall series, by Emma Newman
  * Winternight Trilogy, by Katherine Arden
  * The Wormwood Trilogy, by Tade Thompson

The following finalists for the Hugo Award for Best Series in 2021 are *not* eligible in 2022 *unless* they have published at least two (2) additional installments consisting in total of at least 240,000 words between January 1, 2021 and December 31, 2021:

  * The Daevabad Trilogy, S.A. Chakraborty
  * The Interdependency, John Scalzi
  * The Lady Astronaut Universe, Mary Robinette Kowal
  * The Murderbot Diaries, Martha Wells
  * October Daye, Seanan McGuire
  * The Poppy War, R.F. Kuang

fields.name: Best Related Work
fields.description:
Any work related to the field of science fiction, fantasy, or fandom, appearing for the first time in 2021, or
which has been substantially modified during 2021, and which is either non-fiction or, if fictional, is
noteworthy primarily for aspects other than the fictional text, and which is not eligible in any other
category.

fields.name: Best Graphic Story or Comic
fields.description: Any science fiction or fantasy story told in graphic form, appearing for the first time in 2021.

fields.name: Best Dramatic Presentation, Long Form
fields.description: Any theatrical feature or other production with a complete running time of more than 90 minutes, in any medium of dramatized science fiction, fantasy, or related subjects that has been publicly presented for the first time in its present dramatic form during 2021.

fields.name: Best Dramatic Presentation, Short Form
fields.description: Any television program or other production with a complete running time of 90 minutes or less, in any medium of dramatized science fiction, fantasy, or related subjects that has been publicly presented for the first time in its present dramatic form during 2021.

fields.name: Best Editor, Short Form
fields.description:
The editor of at least four (4) anthologies, collections, or magazine issues (or their equivalent in other
media) primarily devoted to science fiction and/or fantasy, at least one of which was published in 2021.

fields.name: Best Editor, Long Form
fields.description:
The editor of at least four (4) novel-length works primarily devoted to science fiction and/or fantasy
published in 2021, which do not qualify under Best Editor, Short Form.

fields.name: Best Professional Artist
fields.description:
An illustrator whose work has appeared in a professional publication in the field of science fiction or fantasy during 2021. A professional publication is one that meets at least one (1) of the following criteria:
1. It provided at least a quarter of the income of any one person; or
2. It was owned or published by any entity which provided at least a quarter of the income of any of its staff and/or owner.
If possible, please cite an example of the nominee's work. (Failure to provide such references will not invalidate a nomination.)

fields.name: Best Semiprozine
fields.description:
Any generally available non-professional periodical publication devoted to science fiction or fantasy which by the close of 2021 had published at least four (4) issues (or the equivalent in other media), and at least one (1) of which appeared in 2021, which does not qualify as a fancast, and which in 2021 has met at least one (1) of the following criteria:
1. Paid its contributors or staff in other than copies of the publication.
2. Was generally available only for paid purchase.

fields.name: Best Fanzine
fields.description:
Any generally available non-professional periodical publication devoted to science fiction, fantasy, or related subjects which, by the close of 2021, had published at least four (4) issues (or the equivalent in other media), at least one (1) of which appeared in 2021, and which does not qualify as a semiprozine or a fancast, and which in 2021 met neither of the following criteria:
1. Paid its contributors or staff in other than copies of the publication.
2. Was generally available only for paid purchase.

fields.name: Best Fancast
fields.description:
Any generally available non-professional audio or video periodical devoted to science fiction, fantasy, or
related subjects that by the close of 2021 has released four (4) or more episodes, at least one (1) of which
appeared in 2021, and that does not qualify as a dramatic presentation.

fields.name: Best Fan Writer
fields.description:
A person whose writing has appeared in fanzines or semiprozines, or in generally available electronic media in 2021.
If possible, please cite an example of the nominee's work. (Failure to provide such references will not invalidate a nomination.)

fields.name: Best Fan Artist
fields.description:
An artist or cartoonist whose work has appeared through publication in fanzines, semiprozines, or through any other public non-professional display (including at a convention or conventions) in 2021.
If possible, please cite an example of the nominee's work. (Failure to provide such references will not invalidate a nomination.)

fields.name: Lodestar Award for Best Young Adult Book (not a Hugo)
fields.description:
A book published for young adult readers in the field of science fiction or fantasy appearing for the first time in
2021.

fields.name: Astounding Award for the Best New Writer, sponsored by Dell Magazines (not a Hugo)
fields.description:
A new writer is one whose first work of science fiction or fantasy appeared in 2020 or 2021 in a professional publication. For Astounding Award purposes, a professional publication is one for which more than a nominal amount was paid, any publication that had an average press run of at least 10,000 copies, or any other criteria that the Award sponsors may designate.
If possible, please cite an example of the nominee's work. (Failure to provide such references will not invalidate a nomination.)
